text.section: With the advice of the Council, the Department shall adopt rules and regulations to carry out the provisions of this subtitle.

Before adopting any rule or regulation that relates to substances governed by the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act, the Department shall submit the rule or regulation to the State Secretary of Agriculture for review and approval.

A rule or regulation under this subtitle may:
Apply to pollutant and hazardous substance sources located outside this State that cause, contribute to, or threaten environmental damage in this State;
Make special provisions for alert and abatement standards and procedures for occurrences or emergencies of pollution or on other short term conditions that are an acute danger to public health or to the environment;
Specify different provisions as circumstances require for different:
Pollutant, solid waste, and hazardous substance sources; and
Geographical areas; or
If an exemption is consistent with federal law or federal regulation, exempt persons from any requirements of this subtitle.

In addition to the other provisions of this section, in its rules and regulations that govern low-level nuclear waste, the Department shall:
Provide for the classification of low-level nuclear wastes by radionuclide content and level of radioactivity for different storage or disposal procedures;
Provide for consultation with any affected political subdivision; and
Set standards and procedures, including notice and hearing requirements, for revocation or suspension of a facility permit, a hauler certificate, or a vehicle certificate.
